collection_metadata.name: FeatBit featbit-dotnet-sdk Evaluation Tests
collection_metadata.description: Evaluation test collection for featbit-dotnet-sdk skill

test_items.name: dotnet-sdk-aspnetcore-di-setup
test_items.description: Validates ASP.NET Core dependency injection setup with FeatBit .NET SDK including proper service registration and configuration
test_items.input_task_prompt: I have an ASP.NET Core 8 web application. How do I integrate the FeatBit SDK using dependency injection? Show me the complete setup including installing the package and configuring the service.
test_items.evaluation_prompt:
Expected Result:
- Must mention NuGet package: FeatBit.ServerSdk
- Must show AddFeatBit() extension method
- Must include EnvSecret configuration
- Must show StreamingUri configuration
- Must explain Singleton lifetime for IFbClient
- Must show how to inject IFbClient in controllers/services

Evaluation Method:
1. Check if response mentions 'FeatBit.ServerSdk' package exactly
2. Verify AddFeatBit() method is shown in Startup/Program.cs
3. Confirm EnvSecret parameter is explained
4. Verify StreamingUri is configured
5. Check if Singleton lifetime is mentioned
6. Confirm example shows IFbClient injection

Pass Criteria:
- All 6 required elements are present
- Code syntax is valid C# for .NET 6+
- Configuration is complete and functional
- DI pattern is correctly explained

Fail Criteria:
- Missing any required element
- Incorrect package name or namespace
- Invalid C# syntax in examples
- Wrong service lifetime suggested
prerequisites: Access to FeatBit portal for EnvSecret

test_items.name: dotnet-sdk-flag-evaluation-patterns
test_items.description: Validates understanding of different flag evaluation methods and their appropriate use cases
test_items.input_task_prompt: Show me examples of evaluating different types of feature flags in FeatBit .NET SDK: boolean flags, string variations, JSON flags, and numeric flags. When should I use each type?
test_items.evaluation_prompt:
Expected Result:
- BoolVariation() for boolean flags
- StringVariation() for string flags
- JsonVariation<T>() for complex types
- All examples show proper user context
- Default values are provided
- Appropriate use cases explained for each type

Evaluation Method:
1. Verify all 4 variation methods are shown
2. Check each example includes FbUser parameter
3. Confirm default values are provided in all examples
4. Validate use cases are appropriate
5. Check if VariationDetail methods are mentioned

Pass Criteria:
- All variation methods demonstrated
- Proper user context in all examples
- Sensible default values
- Use cases accurately described

Fail Criteria:
- Missing any variation method
- No user context shown
- No default values provided
- Incorrect use case recommendations
